questions.Q: The resultant of the four vectors is:

A.opt: 12 cm and points along the positive y-axis
6 cm and points along the positive y-axis
6 units and points along the negative y-axis
12 units and points along the negative y-axis

questions.E: The x components of the upper vectors cancel each other. The same happens for the two lower vectors. The only surviving cooponents are the vertical ones, so that the magnitude of the resultant vector is 12 cm and points along the positive y-axis.

questions.Q: The magnitude of three mutually perpendicular forces $$\vec {F}_1$$, $$\vec {F}_2$$ and $$\vec {F}_3$$ are 2, 10 and 11 N respectively. Then the magnitude of its resultant is:
questions.E: The resultant force is $$\vec{F}=\vec{F}_1+\vec{F}_3+\vec{F}_3$$ where $$|\vec{F}_1|=2\,\text{N}$$, $$|\vec{F}_2|=10\,\text{N}$$ and $$|\vec{F}_1|=11\,\text{N}$$.  $$\Rightarrow \, |\vec{F}|=\sqrt{|\vec{F}_1|^2+|\vec{F}_2|^2+|\vec{F}_3|^2}=\sqrt{(2\,\text{N})^2+(10\,\text{N})^2+(11\,\text{N})^2}=\sqrt{225\,\text{N}^2}=15\,\text{N}$$

questions.Q: The magnitude of two mutually perpendicular forces $$\vec {F}_1$$ and $$\vec {F}_2$$ are 2.0 and 10.0 N respectively. Then the magnitude of its resultant is:
questions.E: The resultant force is $$\vec{F}=\vec{F}_1+\vec{F}_2$$ where $$|\vec{F}_1|=2\,\text{N}$$ and  $$|\vec{F}_2|=10\,\text{N}$$.  $$\Rightarrow\,|\vec{F}|=\sqrt{|\vec{F}_1|^2+|\vec{F}_2|^2}=\sqrt{(2.0\,\text{N})^2+(10.0\,\text{N})^2}=\sqrt{104.0\,\text{N}^2}=10.2\,\text{N}$$

questions.Q: Forces $$\vec{F}_1$$ and $$\vec{F}_2$$ act on a point mass in two mutually perpendicular directions. The magnitude of the resultant force on the point mass will be:
questions.E: The resultant force is $$\vec{F}=\vec{F}_1+\vec{F}_2$$ and its magnitude is $$\Rightarrow\,|\vec{F}|=\sqrt{|\vec{F}_1|^2+|\vec{F}_2|^2}$$
